alert.note: Alert for Colfax (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 10:06PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, Colfax. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1006 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area, and this will add to the potential for minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raton, Raton Crews Airport, Sugarite, Sugarite Canyon State Park and Vermejo Park. - This includes the following recreation areas... McCrystal Creek Campground and Sugarite Canyon State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 333 and 355. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 439 and 460.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
